column4: any one here can help me how to get internet from my linksys router that is connected to my at&t gateway?
SBC or BellSouth?
SBC
i know they do NOT use VCP 35/8 (tried that and it failed with SBC, worked with BellSouth though)
my at&t gatway is able to give the linksys an IP
i connected one of the 4 ports on the AT&T gateway to the WAN of the Linksys router
as an alterative, you can set your linksys to PPPOE and let the modem solely dialup (without the username and pass); have you tried that configuration?
i will try and thanks for helping me out i will try it
i have no luck

did you set your att modem as gateway and removed the username and password from the att modem, and then in linksys enable pppoe, type your username and pass, and plug it in the main ethernet (not one of the four)?
if i remove username and password from att modem i will not have internet
any solution will require that while changing the physical configuration
so u want to test to see if the linksys router is able to get on the internet solely on its own?
not exactly, it still needs the modem, but you need to configure the att modem to be a gateway, not router, and configure your linksys for pppoe to dial the internet for the att gateway
so my linksys will be the gateway and the at&t will be the router?
opposite

your att gateway serves as a modem and gateway/router, but you can get it to only act as a modem if you set it in gateway, then in linksys (router) pppoe (ppp over ethernet) with your username and password
ah i c
that makes sense
it was confiusing to me for the longest time as well
still learning ^^
if att gateway serves at a modem can all the 4 ports that i have ppoe into the internet?
for example 4 routers connected to the 4 ports with ppoe
no, none of the four, it should be the primary one seperate from the four
